source_title: Courage: The Joy of Living Dangerously (Osho Insights for a New Way of Living)
text: Darkness does not exist, you cannot remove darkness. If you want to do something with darkness, you will have to do something with light. Put the light off, darkness is there; put the light on, darkness is not there‚Äîbut you do something with light. You cannot do anything with darkness.

source_title: Courage: The Joy of Living Dangerously (Osho Insights for a New Way of Living)
text: Commit as many mistakes as possible, remembering only one thing: don‚Äôt commit the same mistake again. And you will be growing.

source_title: Courage: The Joy of Living Dangerously (Osho Insights for a New Way of Living)
text: A Buddha is a Buddha, a Krishna is a Krishna, and you are you. And you are not in any way less than anybody else.

source_title: Courage: The Joy of Living Dangerously (Osho Insights for a New Way of Living)
text: The heart is always ready to the risk, the heart is a gambler.

source_title: Courage: The Joy of Living Dangerously (Osho Insights for a New Way of Living)
text: A man who is fearless is neither afraid of anybody nor makes anybody afraid of him. Fear totally disappears.

source_title: Courage: The Joy of Living Dangerously (Osho Insights for a New Way of Living)
text: Don‚Äôt call it uncertainty‚Äîcall it wonder. Don‚Äôt call it insecurity‚Äîcall it freedom

source_title: Courage: The Joy of Living Dangerously (Osho Insights for a New Way of Living)
text: Nobody is against you! Even if you feel somebody is against you, he too is not against you‚Äîbecause everybody is concerned with himself, not with you. There is nothing to fear.

source_title: Courage: The Joy of Living Dangerously (Osho Insights for a New Way of Living)
text: The next moment is meaningless. This moment, this cake is delicious.
It is natural and easy to keep alert while you are in movement. When you are just sitting silently, the natural thing is to just fall asleep.

source_title: Courage: The Joy of Living Dangerously (Osho Insights for a New Way of Living)
text: A fear-oriented man is always calculating, planning, arranging, safeguarding. His whole life is lost in this way.

It is not a fight against society, remember; it is just going beyond society. It is not anti-social, it is asocial; it has nothing to do with society. It is not against slavery, it is for freedom ‚Äì freedom to be.
You don‚Äôt impose any order, you don‚Äôt impose any discipline; you simply drop all structures, you simply become natural and spontaneous.
A man who forces order from the outside remains in disorder.
There are three things that are never at rest in anyone: the heart in working, the breath in moving, and the soul in purposing.
Three things to be avoided by the Wise: expecting the impossible, grieving over the irretrievable, fearing the inevitable.
Three candles that illumine every darkness: truth, nature, knowledge

First one has to become harmonious within oneself and then one can be harmonious with the universe, with the stars and the moon and the sun and the trees and the birds ‚Äì one can merge into this whole, vast, infinite universe.
There are two mergers: one within yourself, the first unity, and the second, with the whole, the second unity. And within these two steps the whole journey is complete.
Iron chains are not as dangerous because you can see them, and because you can see them they can be broken.
The chains created by desires are invisible, and because you cannot see them you go on thinking you are free.
A man living in desires is not a free man, he is living in constant bondage. He always desires more. His greed is his imprisonment: he will live like a prisoner and die like a prisoner.
Every human being brings a truth into the world. Every human being is a messenger of existence.
You have to sing the song of your heart. You have to dance your dance. You have to be utterly individual, not an imitation, not a carbon copy. You have to bring out your original face.
The moment you are able to reveal your original face to the world, your life will be fulfilled. Tremendous joy arises out of it.
Never, never, for a single moment lose your freedom. And never destroy anybody else‚Äôs freedom.
Remember again and again: seeing the sky, know that you are also the sky; seeing the stars, know that the stars are within you. You are within the sky, the sky is within you.
Love cannot be made a duty; the moment you make it a duty it becomes artificial, superficial.

‚ÄòParticipating?‚Äô I ask, screwing up my face. ‚ÄòParticipating in what?‚Äô
Jenny sighs again. ‚ÄòIn life, Leo. I want you to start participating in life.‚Äô

source_title: Courage: The Joy of Living Dangerously (Osho Insights for a New Way of Living)
text: They say: Think twice before you jump. I say: Jump first and then think as much as you want!

source_title: Courage: The Joy of Living Dangerously (Osho Insights for a New Way of Living)
text: A man becomes fearless by accepting his fears. It is not a question of bravery. It is simply seeing into the facts of life and realizing that these fears are natural.

source_title: Courage: The Joy of Living Dangerously (Osho Insights for a New Way of Living)
text: If you are too afraid of the enemy then the friend also cannot enter.

source_title: Courage: The Joy of Living Dangerously (Osho Insights for a New Way of Living)
text: Just be yourself, whatever it is.

source_title: Courage: The Joy of Living Dangerously (Osho Insights for a New Way of Living)
text: Just be yourself, whatever it is. Never before has anybody told you to be yourself. Everybody is poking his nose in, saying that you should be this way.

source_title: Courage: The Joy of Living Dangerously (Osho Insights for a New Way of Living)
text: Nobody else can answer your question ‚ÄúWho am I?‚Äù‚Äîyou will know it.

source_title: Courage: The Joy of Living Dangerously (Osho Insights for a New Way of Living)
text: Don‚Äôt be worried, because that which can disappear is worth disappearing. It is meaningless to cling to it‚Äîit is not yours, it is not you.

source_title: Courage: The Joy of Living Dangerously (Osho Insights for a New Way of Living)
text: Meditation is just a courage to be silent and alone.

source_title: Courage: The Joy of Living Dangerously (Osho Insights for a New Way of Living)
text: Love sharpens intelligence, fear dulls it.

source_title: Courage: The Joy of Living Dangerously (Osho Insights for a New Way of Living)
text: Bravery exists only in the ocean of fear, bravery is an island in the ocean of fear. Fear is there, but in spite of the fear one takes the risk‚Äîthat is bravery.

source_title: Courage: The Joy of Living Dangerously (Osho Insights for a New Way of Living)
text: One trembles, one is afraid to go into the dark, and still one goes.

Escaping from darkness will not bring light, only a deeper darkness. It is not a question of darkness at all. It is a question of being asleep. Wake up, and the darkness will be gone. Waking up is light.
For, as you say, ‚ÄúWhat is the point of getting upset when the birds have already eaten the crops‚Äù?
The ocean takes care of the waves, and the waves are forever carefree. The sky takes care of the stars, and the stars are forever blissful.
Evil is not an enemy of the good. Rather, evil is simply good that has been blocked.
Drop this fear, because the moment you hold on to fear it increases. To hold on to it is to nourish it.
When the night is darkest, know that the dawn is near.
Every moment is precious.
Nothing can happen before its time. Everything takes time to grow.
In the words of that old saying: ‚ÄúBuild a life you don‚Äôt need a vacation from.‚Äù
We are not built to hold on to everything life sends our way. We are meant to feel, process and accept. That‚Äôs the way our design works best.
Reading in the company of someone who is also reading makes for an amazing, unspoken, felt connection.
What you seek is seeking you. Let that sink in.
I am the one who decides that I belong. All along, I‚Äôve thought it was others who had this power. No.
We carry inside us the wonders we seek outside us.
I respect your feelings, but I am not responsible for your feelings.
I turned it into me versus the world. I was losing an imaginary battle. It is always you versus you.
The journey starts and ends with you. Keep the faith.
To figure out what you want and how to get it, you must follow your own path. To certain onlookers you might appear lost. You are not lost. You are exploring.
Don‚Äôt fall for the idea that you need a relationship to be happy.
When nothing works keep working.
By being honest I flip my vulnerabilities into victories.
Don‚Äôt give a fuck what anyone else says about you. Give more fucks about what you say about you.
People will try to tell you how to be you. They will tell you how and when to live, how to talk, how to dress, etc. Do not become a vending machine.
If you play for points, you will quit. The game is what keeps you going. You play it, simply for the sake of playing, because without it you are simply not living.
